trans-unit.source: Provides <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement"></xref> objects for each state of the drop-down portion of a combined regular button and drop-down button.
This class cannot be inherited.

Each property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.ToolBar.SplitButtonDropDown> class returns a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> for a different state of the drop-down portion of a combined regular button and drop-down button.
Gets a visual style element that represents a split drop-down button in the checked state.

You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.ToolBar.SplitButtonDropDown.Checked%2A> property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement"></xref> that represents a split drop-down button in the checked state.
Gets a visual style element that represents a split drop-down button in the disabled state.

You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.ToolBar.SplitButtonDropDown.Disabled%2A> property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement"></xref> that represents a split drop-down button in the disabled state.
Gets a visual style element that represents a split drop-down button in the hot state.

You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.ToolBar.SplitButtonDropDown.Hot%2A> property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement"></xref> that represents a split drop-down button in the hot state.
Gets a visual style element that represents a split drop-down button in the hot and checked states.

You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.ToolBar.SplitButtonDropDown.HotChecked%2A> property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement"></xref> that represents a split drop-down button in the hot and checked states.
Gets a visual style element that represents a split drop-down button in the normal state.

You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.ToolBar.SplitButtonDropDown.Normal%2A> property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement"></xref> that represents a split drop-down button in the normal state.
Gets a visual style element that represents a split drop-down button in the pressed state.

You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.ToolBar.SplitButtonDropDown.Pressed%2A> property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement"></xref> that represents a split drop-down button in the pressed state.
